alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:34PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jackson and central Seminole Counties through 715 PM EDT/615 PM CDT/... At 634 PM EDT/534 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Chattahoochee, or 16 miles east of Marianna, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Seminole State Park, Desser, Haynes, Drakes Still, Reynoldsville, Fairchild and Lake Seminole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
